intro_text: The cats head out into the crisp clear newleaf sun, p_l leading them towards a massive messy eagle nest.
decline_text: When they get there, they discover that this nest isn't being used this newleaf. Disappointing.

success_outcomes.text: This close to the nest the eagles take remarkably little notice of other animals. app1 can even see sparrows nipping in and out of their own nests, tiny things woven into the eagle one. It's a great opportunity to watch the birds and learn their body language, and a side of them app1 never expected to see, observing them with their chicks.

p_l tells app1 to watch carefully as the parents arrive at and leave the nest - this is one of the only times a cat can study how an eagle flies without danger. The adults are far too focused on their brood, and their brood far too focused on squabbling, for either to notice the c_n cats.

As they hide, watching the eagles feed their chicks, s_c tells app1 the story of an eagle chick that once fell from its nest and was abandoned by its parents. c_n took it in, and when it fledged over its first winter, it turned into a fierce, she-cat whose claws could stand up to even the mightiest predator.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 refuses to believe that going near an eagle camp could ever possibly be safe and flatly refuses to go.
p_l can't get app1 to take the training session seriously. They keep making too much noise, not understanding the importance and danger of the opportunity.

intro_text: The apprentices emerge into a predawn world hushed and smothered in a new coating of snow! app1 and app2 tear off into the territory near camp, looking to play.
decline_text: Their mentors are already up for the day, and call them back. There'll be time to play later.

success_outcomes.text: The snow seems to have melted and refrozen during the night, and app1 darts lightly over the top of the thin crust. app2 follows them, only to immediately hear a crack and sink up to their haunches in the fluffy stuff. Teasingly, app1 runs around near them, and it turns into a game of app2 romping through the snow trying to catch them.

app1 finds a snowdrift, and over the course of an hour them and app2 turn it into a very respectable snow den, complete with short entrance tunnel. They're debating what to call the camp of their little Clan when their mentors arrive, congratulating them on running an excellent wilderness survival session without supervision.

After a while romping around in the snow, app1 complains of the cold seeping into their fur. s_c digs a little hollow, and invites them in to curl up with them. Strictly for warmth purposes of course. They both stay there as the sun rises. Strictly for warmth.

fail_outcomes.text: The apprentices find a promising looking patch of fresh snow, only to find it conceals an old dirtplace trench underneath. Not only does it stink, but now they have to clean it up too, all while trying to hide the fact that they disturbed it in the first place! It leaves them both irritated and stressed.
As they play in the snow, app1 falls over themselves embarrassingly, and suddenly decides they remember that they have other things they should be doing.

intro_text: Look at this. p_l gesture with their tail, calling app1's attention to the other side of the vast valley. In the snow, something is erupting out of a massive burrow.
decline_text: Let's not be anywhere near a bear newly emerged from hibernation, the cats decide.

success_outcomes.text: Have you ever starved? Felt hunger gnawing your belly until it flips, filled it with water just to get a moment's relief, felt your limbs tremble with weakness as your mind desperately yearns for prey? How long did that take, a day, a week? Imagine months without food. Stay away from bears emerging from hibernation.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 takes one look at the bear emerging on the opposite slope, and turns to run for home.
